techmeme.title: Microsoft AI CEO Mustafa Suleyman says an "off-frontier" strategy of building models "three or six months behind" cuts costs and helps focus on some use cases (Jordan Novet/CNBC)
Stanford's 2025 AI index: China files more AI patents than the US, but US companies produced 40 frontier models, compared to 15 from China and three from Europe (Will Knight/Wired)
Huawei says it "terminated the employment of two individuals" from April 1 and suspended a third from April 2 in response to the EU corruption scandal (Mathieu Pollet/Politico)
Global chip stocks drop as the US tariff rout on markets intensifies, extending last week's losses; Nvidia, Intel, ASML, SK Hynix, Infineon, and STMicro fall (Mauro Orru/Wall Street Journal)
SignalFire raised a $1B+ fund to bet on early-stage AI startups, taking its AUM to $3B, and plans to use AI to spot market trends to help portfolio companies (Katie Roof/Bloomberg)
